#Text=Boat Green
#Text=Boating usually brings thoughts of blue skies and water but nowadays , many boaters are starting to think green — that is , environmentally friendly .
#Text=You might have heard of green houses and green cars , so it ’s also logical to consider that the next step are green boats !
#Text=Here are some tips on how to get started " boating green " today .

column1: #Text=Steps
#Text=Prevent oily discharges from the bilge .
#Text=Keep your engine well tuned to prevent fuel and oil leaks .
#Text=Place an oil absorbent pad in your bilge and under your engine where drips may occur .
#Text=Check the pads often ; do n’t let them clog the bilge pump , and dispose of them as hazardous waste at a marina or local hazardous waste collection center .
#Text=Spill-proof your oil changes by using an oil change pump to transfer oil to a spill-proof container .
#Text=Wrap a plastic bag or absorbent pad around the oil filter to stop oil from spilling into the bilge .
#Text=When fueling , prevent fuel spills by filling fuel tanks slowly and catching drips and spills with absorbent pads or rags .
#Text=Do n’t " top off " or overflow your fuel tank .
#Text=Leave the tank ten percent empty to allow fuel to expand as it warms .
#Text=Do not add soap .
#Text=Never use soap to disperse fuel and oil spills .
#Text=It ’s illegal and it increases harm to the environment .
#Text=Save boat cleaning and maintenance projects for the boatyard whenever possible .
#Text=If you must work on the water , minimize your impact by containing waste .
#Text=Use tarps and vacuum sanders to collect all drips and debris for proper disposal .
#Text=Reduce toxic discharges from bottom paints by using a less toxic , or nontoxic anti- fouling paint .
#Text=Use non-abrasive underwater hull cleaning techniques to prevent excessive paint discharge .
#Text=Remember , dry storage reduces the need for antifouling paints and saves money .
#Text=Dispose of hazardous waste at a hazardous waste collection facility or event .
#Text=This includes paints , batteries , antifreeze , cleaning products , oil and oil filters .
#Text=Plan ahead .
#Text=Manage sewage wastes properly .
#Text=Never discharge sewage within of shore .
#Text=Use harbor pump-out stations and shore-side facilities .
#Text=If you do n’t have an installed toilet , use a port-a-potty and empty it at a harbor dump station or bathroom .
#Text=Keep your trash on board .
#Text=Never throw cigarette butts , fishing line , or any other garbage into the ocean .
#Text=Recycle plastic , glass , metal , and paper at shore-side facilities .
#Text=Reduce grey water pollution and its impact on the marine environment by using a phosphate-free biodegradable soap .
#Text=Do dishes and showers on shore whenever possible .
#Text=( Grey water is the soapy water used in boat maintenance . )
#Text=Sail .
#Text=Wind is a freely renewable and sustainable resource .
#Text=Video
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Make sure to properly dispose of any gas or oil soaked rags or pads as they will be highly flammable
#Text=Always consult your owner ’s manual for maintenance instructions specific to your boat model before performing any maintenance on your boat
